text: Shop drawings and cutsheets reviewed for each furnishing item (bench, bike rack, bollard, receptacle, etc.)
Furnishing layout coordinated with civil/landscape drawings and staked
Conflicts with sidewalks, trees, hydrants, utilities, and clearances resolved before install
Concrete pad or base slab complete and verified flat and level
Anchor bolts, sleeve inserts, or embedded plates located and coordinated
Bench alignment consistent with drawings and parallel to curb/sidewalk
All anchor bolts torqued and hidden hardware capped (if applicable)
Bollards installed at correct spacing, depth, and setback (e.g., min 1m clearance)
Waste/recycle receptacles mounted plumb, accessible, and with liners installed
Bike racks anchored securely and accessible with no conflict with pedestrian paths
All site furnishings cleaned, tags removed, and inspected for damage
All furnishings meet accessibility standards for height, spacing, and placement
Final layout confirmed by consultant or landscape architect
